page.title: 04Education in the Felton Area
page.content: Before 1972 the children of this area were educated in two small church schools. The reception class was held at Ullingswick and the two classes of older children were at Preston Wynne. At the age of eleven the children transfered to Bromyard Secondary School. After 1972 all children up to the age of eleven went to the new Burley Gate Church of England Primary School. This school now has 135 pupils in 6 classes. There are five teaching staff and a head-mistress. Four ancillary workers and two cleaners are employed. The children are brought by bus from within a radius of six miles. The subjects taught are English, Mathematics, Science, History, Geography, Environmental Studies, Art, Craft and Needlework, Religious Education and Physical Education.
